wikipedia_page.main: Catherine Davies (1773 – after 1841), was a Welsh governess and autobiographer. She served as governess to Joachim Murat and Caroline Bonaparte, who were the King and Queen of Naples. Davies later sold her story in a book in 1841.

response: Murat's governess was Catherine Davies from Anglesey in Wales. In 1841, she published a memoir describing her eleven years' service with the Murat family.William Roberts, ‘Davies, Catherine (b. 1773, d. in or after 1841)’, rev. J. Gilliland, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004 accessed 29 Nov 2014
**Catherine Davies, royal governess and memoirist (died c.1841)
Catherine Davies or similar may refer to:
* Catherine Davies (governess) (1773–after 1841), Governess in Naples who sold her story in a book
